bow: okay moms my daughter bff just came out as trans ftm here how handled it hoping someone had similar experience tl dr daughters lifelong friend now presents male they re upset we re applying house rules that forbid opposite sex friends in bedrooms looking for any advice or stories of experiences like this here the back story grew up with this kid mom we were best friends for nearly 20 years until she developed nasty drug habit her crazy behavior ultimately culminated in her making false reports to child services in an attempt to get back at me our friendship needless to say did not survive after that prior to that time we been quite close we both have daughters they re about year apart in age and until my daughter was they were together often our girls have always been very close but after the blowout with my former friend we did see either of them for several years flash forward about years letter is dropped at the house the kid wants to reconnect she living with dad parents now mom not in the picture okay we say come on by you re always welcome she shows up we have great time her and my daughter hang out all is good we do hear from her again until about 6mos later get text saying there something she like to talk about has nothing to do with her mom but it important and self related okaaay come on by we say time she to arrive comes and goes and get another text basically hey identify as male now did know how to tell you should still come woah okay my 12yo is expecting her childhood girl friend how do explain this talk to my husband what we come up with is not my kid not my business if this is what makes her happy can swap name and pronoun still the same kid just different haircut as far as this concerns us so we talk to our daughter explain that this is evidently what makes her friend happy and since it has no bearing on our lives the only right thing to do in our opinion is simply accept the changes and be happy for her friend that they ve found something that gives them some peace awesome so respond to the text is there name change we need to know preferred pronouns and of *course you should still come ca promise we ll get it right all the time but we ll definitely try if you re cool being patient while we adjust so we play it out see what happens kiddo shows up and we were right same kid different haircut here where my daughter is mad at me we mentioned after her friend had left that since he boy now he ll have to follow boy rules no boys in girl bedrooms just like no girls in boy bedrooms literally nothing else changes concerned that her friend will take this change personally but my feeling is that if he like to be treated like male the best and only thing can do is treat him like boy all the way and sorry but no you wo be allowed in her bedroom alone behind closed doors it has nothing to do with anything else but fairness idk what doing here this seems punitive for both kids for no reason can they leave the door cracked little honestly it in the interest of fairness across the board my daughter has several male friends not to mention cousins and brother etc there are often large groups of kids here can not treat one seemingly male child differently than all the others her brother isn allowed in the room with her alone nope opposite gender kids have different toys different styles of play etc bedrooms are for sleeping or private activities our feeling is that there should be private activities going on between the sexes behind closed doors between children and while referring to stuff like doing hair or whatever same rules apply to bathrooms okay be real when you say private activities are you referring to masturbation changing clothes it prevents lot of fights we want kids to be in eyesight so they re welcome to run off outside or take to corner of common area for privacy etc this literally only applies to bedrooms any personal stuff changing clothes grooming that kinda stuff we really encourage all kids to play or hang out in common areas we just feel like bedrooms are *really not where guests should be like to simply ban guests in bedrooms across the board for all the kids but it does make sense for sleepovers and stuff guess my perspective is that bedrooms are kinda sacred it your personal space where you keep your stuff where you re safe to be do look etc however you want feel like we have enough space in other areas to entertain guests and have privacy without needing to invite them into our bedrooms do like people in *our bedroom and want my kids to have that same degree of privacy and respect for their own space there *lot of stuff that plays into that perspective but yeah like to straight up ban guests in bedrooms altogether don know if agree with your rule but as for your handling of this situation it sounds to me like you ve gotten it 100 right you re treating your daughter friend exactly like all of her other male friends and you ve been completely accepting of him props to you for quality parenting mean 100 honest banning people from bedrooms when they usually are in there to not have overheard conversations will probably backfire and limiting it to opposite gender assumes your kids are straight my parents made this mistake and as bisexual female had girlfriends sleeping overnight in my room having sex with them as early as 15 and when had boyfriend at 17 snuck him in there anyhow it just teaches your kids to be sneaky personally would allow maximum guest bedroom limits depending on the bedroom size and have the door open bit rather than an outright ban just my cents though you re the boss in that house as far as treating trans person as their preferred gender mean it fair but still kinda shitty get both sides he wants to be considered male and that the house rule for males but he never had an issue before and it honestly does make much sense to suddenly ban someone based on that alone with no priors see my first point on banning genders that makes sense that tad nuts do think your being unreasonable when it comes to boys outside the family inside the family is bit extreme in my opinion but that your decision but look at it this way what happens if they are still friends when he starts exploring his sexuality what if he chooses your daughter as the person he wants to explore with receptive or not this is exactly what you do want your daughter to be doing with him or anyone else who is male in her room also sure that if your daughter came out as gay the rule would turn into no females in her room so it sounds like you are being fair as you can be across the board think if the rule was already in effect before friend transitioned then there really should be fuss these are your established house rules if its always been this way then imagine your daughter should understand that these rules still apply regardless however if this was rule that did exist previously would have to encourage you to reconsider putting it into effect now making rule like this now would definitely come across as being bias against the transition and create unnecessary tension especially if you re trying to be supportive get it we have home with small bedrooms and plenty of common space like to leave bedrooms for sleeping our kids don have toys in their rooms you re just teaching them how to be sneaky why not leave the bedroom door open and allow them to hang out in there also it seems like you re assuming your daughter and her now male friend are straight not always the case her friend may be attracted to men women or both same with your daughter aww that awesome thank you at the end of the day we re just trying to be fair to all the kids other people kids included idk if there is any other way to raise kids than live and let live just want them to go find their own happiness and encourage others to do so as well what funniest to me about this is that my kid has made it pretty clear she at least bi if not straight up lesbian and we were like whatever least you wo come up preggo otherwise we do care who you love but that is another layer that plays into us wanting to just whole handedly ban guests in bedrooms altogether she only 12 but she wo be for long we re moving to new house soon so we re likely going to institute that rule in the new house this is where leaning with all of it think sleepovers can occur in literally any other area bedrooms in the new house are small and think are going to be designated for sleeping or being alone only then why the ban on gender at all what the actual point it seems like an arbitrary rule that only has purpose in enforcing you as boss and that never works out well with teenagers involved if she lesbian sex with the guys is non issue saw in different comment that you said the genders play differently and you re trying to curb fighting what the issue is it destructive why not just disallow siblings from being in each other rooms it seems like friends would have this issue not sure why all the downvoting here agree it teaches kids to be sneaky however not my house not my rules all we can do is offer different perspectives think my new policy upon moving to our new house is that bedrooms are for sleeping or being alone they re small and there really do need to be guests in anyone bedrooms yeah this has made me realize that best course of action is to simply ban guests in bedrooms at all there really no reason it ever need to happen and it the only real way to be fair about it it would be nice if everyone else would practice that philosophy yes this is good policy if there no guests in the bedrooms for anyone ever it much more non discriminatory and presumptive makes it feel like little more trust rather than the notion that people of opposite genders can be trusted together agreed there really no reason *to have guests in your bedroom and with the smaller bedrooms in the new place going to use the move as my reasoning forextending the ban to include all guests mean that where would lean if you want bedrooms to be sacred get that your perspective is that bedrooms are sacred but consider how that makes the kids feel not having the ability to allow their friends to see the most intimate part of their lives the bedroom being sacred space it allows not only for privacy but it kinda like physical representation of who you are as person when someone goes missing there are teams of professionals who need maybe an hour in that missing person room to understand who that person is as human being and learn how their mind works allowing them to try and retrace some steps or understand motives as kid letting your friends in your room is really big step to showing them who you are and sharing yourself with them on deep personal level it opens them up to so much opportunity for new adventures and conversations it allows them to feel comfortable and safe even with an open door as they discuss private matters that they just are not able to get from finding corner of the yard would you have an intimate conversation with your husband on the couch if you thought your kids would come home at any minute and hear it probably not the conversations may be about innocuous topics but the environment feeling safe is really essential to them as teens and preteens giving them space is also very important in parenting and enacting restrictions that solve nothing but imposing your perspective on them will definitely backfire that being said if you re going to ban banning everyone is good idea but you *need* to help them understand the why behind it or you re going to have bad time op has mentioned her daughter being min bi likely lesbian this friends in bedrooms thing only started recently and is directly result of her little brother being born and wanting to also play with the girls we lapsed on enforcing the rule with sleepover or two and it kinda blowing up in our faces my daughter is well aware that we re not super fond of her having friends up there of any gender so doubt just saying no guests is going to blow up too much on us there are many rooms in the new house and plenty of privacy without needing to be behind door in bedroom that fair enough of the mindset that as an adult we consider bedrooms to be for private stuff because *we run the house* but as kid we run exactly nothing our room is our house it our only space but again your house your rules just be sure they get the why behind things gt like to simply ban guests in bedrooms across the board for all the kids but it does make sense for sleepovers and stuff can they not sleep in the living room or another common area for sleep overs when was growing up we always did sleepovers in the
